name: Soya Chaap Tikka

steps.instruction: Marinate the main ingredient with yogurt, spices, and ginger-garlic paste. Let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
Thread marinated pieces onto skewers. Grill or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally.
Brush with oil or butter halfway through cooking for extra moisture.
Remove from heat when charred and cooked through. Serve hot with chutney.

chefTips: Squeeze out excess water from soya before marinating for better flavor absorption
Brush skewers with oil and preheat the grill for best charred flavor
Don't overcrowd the grill; leave space between skewers for even cooking
Adjust chili powder to taste; start with less if you prefer milder heat
Use fresh spices for the best aroma and flavor
whyItWorks: The smoky char from high-heat cooking adds depth. Bold spices create layers of complex flavor.

name: Tandoori Soya Chaap

steps.instruction: Prepare all ingredients by washing, chopping, and measuring as needed.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add aromatics and let them cook until fragrant.
Add main ingredients and spices. Mix well and cook according to dish requirements.
Adjust seasoning and garnish. Serve hot.

chefTips: Squeeze out excess water from soya before marinating for better flavor absorption
Adjust chili powder to taste; start with less if you prefer milder heat
Use fresh spices for the best aroma and flavor
whyItWorks: The smoky char from high-heat cooking adds depth. Bold spices create layers of complex flavor.

name: Veg Butter Masala

steps.instruction: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and all dry spices. Cook until oil separates from the masala.
Add the main ingredient and mix well. Pour in water or coconut milk as needed.
Simmer covered for 15-20 minutes until cooked through. Garnish with fresh coriander.

chefTips: Use fresh spices for the best aroma and flavor
whyItWorks: The combination of spices and cooking technique creates a harmonious balance of flavors.

name: Mushroom Tikka Masala

steps.instruction: Marinate the main ingredient with yogurt, spices, and ginger-garlic paste. Let it rest for at least 30 minutes.
Thread marinated pieces onto skewers. Grill or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally.
Brush with oil or butter halfway through cooking for extra moisture.
Remove from heat when charred and cooked through. Serve hot with chutney.

chefTips: Brush skewers with oil and preheat the grill for best charred flavor
Don't overcrowd the grill; leave space between skewers for even cooking
Use fresh spices for the best aroma and flavor
whyItWorks: The smoky char from high-heat cooking adds depth. Bold spices create layers of complex flavor.

name: Bhindi Masala

steps.instruction: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and all dry spices. Cook until oil separates from the masala.
Add the main ingredient and mix well. Pour in water or coconut milk as needed.
Simmer covered for 15-20 minutes until cooked through. Garnish with fresh coriander.

chefTips: Use fresh spices for the best aroma and flavor
whyItWorks: The combination of spices and cooking technique creates a harmonious balance of flavors.

name: Mysore Masala Dosa

steps.instruction: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and all dry spices. Cook until oil separates from the masala.
Add the main ingredient and mix well. Pour in water or coconut milk as needed.
Simmer covered for 15-20 minutes until cooked through. Garnish with fresh coriander.

chefTips: Adjust chili powder to taste; start with less if you prefer milder heat
